text: Head to the "Demigod Council" Dawncloud and continue your adventure

title: Mission Description
content: The Eye of Twilight, a sky barrier named after a Titan, was both the homeland of the Sky people in ancient times and now serves as Aquila's dwelling. With Hyacine's help, we have set foot on this outworld land to find the Titan who binds the sky.

text: A few days later, at Dawncloud...

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ (Today's the day...)

speaker: Mem
line: Wow, I didn't expect it to be so lively up here...

speaker: Mem
line: Are these people here to send off the Chrysos Heirs?

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ There's Phainon. Let's go talk to him.

text: Head to the "Fortress of Dome" Eye of Twilight and continue your adventure

speaker: Phainon
line: ...I know this is a big ask, Mnemosyne — I hope you understand.

speaker: Mnemosyne the Guard
line: Please, don't say that, Lord Phainon. It's an honor to for us to be entrusted with this task.

speaker: Phainon
line: Go, then. Let's hope our concerns don't come true.

speaker: Mnemosyne the Guard
line: I hope you all return safely, my lord.

speaker: Phainon
line: ▶ Ah, there you are, (Trailblazer).

speaker: Phainon
line: You didn't oversleep this time, did you?

text: A pink puppy woke me up.

children.speaker: Mem
children.line: ...You like calling me that, don't you? Well, I've embraced it now. It doesn't even faze me anymore!

text: I never show up late for important things.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Hahaha... always dependable. I just hope you didn't lose any sleep. We've still got a tough fight ahead.

text: Well, maybe I'll go back and grab a quick nap.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Since you're here, make yourself comfortable. You can take a nap while we're waiting for everyone else.

speaker: Phainon
line: Ready, comrade? If all goes according to plan... this could be the last battle where we fight at each other's side.

speaker: Phainon
line: If the curse separating Amphoreus from the world beyond the sky is truly Aquila 's doing, then you'll be able to return home after their fall.

text: A day on the ground feels like ten years in the sky...

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Really? That's the first time I've heard that...

children.speaker: Mem
children.line: ▶ ( He / She ) just makes things up. Don't take it too seriously.

text: That's assuming we can fix the car.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Ah... sorry, I'm no help there.

children.speaker: Mem
children.line: ▶ Don't worry. Dan Heng mentioned that Councillor Lygus can help (Trailblazer) with that.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: ...You sound a little insincere there, buddy.

children.speaker: Mem
children.line: ...That was totally insincere, partner!

text: Aren't I supposed to be reincarnating as a Titan?

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: That would be a problem... We'll need to get you home before Era Nova.

speaker: Phainon
line: Let's leave the emotional goodbyes for later. That'll give us some time to figure out what we should be feeling at that time. Besides, when we were playing Seal... Slammers...

speaker: Phainon
line: ...Ahem, that bumping seal game. Didn't you teach me something back then?

speaker: Phainon
line: "Crack the champagne at halftime to watch victory slip away!"

text: Well, it's 10/12th time now. We can totally open the champagne.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Well, then I have to use something else Dan Heng taught me as come back — "The last mile is the hardest."

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: "The last mile is the hardest." — That's from Dan Heng. Same principle, just... more elegantly put.

speaker: Mem
line: Hey, speaking of Dan Heng... where is he?

speaker: Phainon
line: He arrived before everyone else and climbed to the cliff top to wait for us. He's probably not keen on being the center of attention...

speaker: Worried Citizen
line: Lord Phainon, please make sure you all come back safely!

speaker: Virtuous Citizen
line: Please defeat the indifferent Eye of Twilight , and restore a compassionate sky to Amphoreus.

speaker: Phainon
line: Thank you all for your blessings! Rest assured. We're fully prepared.

speaker: Phainon
line: But I'm not the main attraction today. Please don't hesitate to cheer for Miss Hyacine when she arrives.

speaker: Eager Citizen
line: Miss Hyacine, the chosen daughter of the Sky... the pride of the Twilight Courtyard!

speaker: Phainon
line: She's not just the pride of Okhema, but all of Amphoreus as well. And furthermore...

speaker: Phainon
line: While the Flame-Chase Journey is led by the Chrysos Heirs, it's not just those chosen by Aglaea who contributed to it.

speaker: Phainon
line: Let's extend our gratitude to the two warriors of the outlands — who bravely stepped up and risked their lives for those they've never met!

speaker: Virtuous Citizen
line: ▶ Hero (Trailblazer), your saga will be chronicled in epics and celebrated across the new world!

speaker: Eager Citizen
line: Warrior from the outlands! Endowed with the might of Oronyx! The vanguard of deliverance!

text: Looks like you've mastered public speaking now.

speaker: Phainon
line: Ha... After all this time, you should know when I'm just being polite and when I'm genuinely speaking from the heart.

speaker: Phainon
line: ▶ That praise was heartfelt, (Trailblazer). Had I not trusted my instincts and put my faith in you and Dan Heng, it's hard to imagine what might have become of Okh-

speaker: Phainon
line: ...Ah, the guest of honor has arrived.

speaker: Hyacine
line: People of Okhema, I've been blessed by the ancestors of the Sky people.

speaker: Hyacine
line: They have agreed to bestow the thousand-year mission to me and to have me claim the Coreflame of Aquila .

speaker: Hyacine
line: Today is the year 4932 of the Light Calendar, 1062 years since the hero Seliose initiated the Flame-Chase Journey.

speaker: Hyacine
line: I, Hyacinthia of the Sky people, am prepared to lead the children of humanity back to the sky.

speaker: Phainon
line: History doesn't breathe evenly. At times, it suspends its breath for millennia as though time has frozen. At other times, it pants rapidly, as if poised to topple the world and our civilization in an instant.

speaker: Phainon
line: Its hurried gasps have sparked a tempest, sweeping all of us along. Hyacine, as an observer, you've witnessed the return of four Coreflames...

speaker: Phainon
line: And now it's your turn to fulfil your duty. Please, guide us into the heart of the storm as the executioner of this mission.

speaker: Kremnoan Child
line: Miss Hyacine! May Mydeimos protect you!

speaker: Gravitas
line: I hope the Chrysos Heirs triumph... and bring light to this darkening world.

speaker: Passionate Bard
line: They'll surely seize the Coreflame of Sky... and bring the Flame-Chase Journey to its perfect conclusion!

speaker: Phainon
line: Thanks for waiting, Dan Heng.

speaker: Phainon
line: The team tasked with conquering Aquila has finally assembled.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: We've reshaped the history of the world with our hands over and over.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: I bet this trailblazing expedition... could even make Akivili jealous.

text: We'll go home as soon as this battle finishes!
Such an exciting adventure! March's gonna be crying with jealousy!
This trailblazing expedition is about to end perfectly!

speaker: Phainon
line: So full of energy, comrades. Seems I chose the perfect day.

speaker: Phainon
line: Hyacine, it's all yours now.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Legend tells of the Skyfolk once divided into many tribes.

speaker: Hyacine
line: The Sunfolk worshiped the sun, the Rainfolk were devoted to storms, and the Winterfolk waited for signs in the snow...

speaker: Hyacine
line: Our ancestors lived under Aquila's light, yet they were blinded to all but one color.

speaker: Hyacine
line: They forgot that... the light that illuminates the world is made of countless different colors.

speaker: Hyacine
line: That's why the rainbow is my favorite, for not only does it reflect the many colors, it is also a bridge.

speaker: Hyacine
line: And I want to use the rainbow bridge to link everyone's hearts... and give hope to every soul on earth.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Ancestors!

speaker: Hyacine
line: With the rainbow as your guide, lead me back to the home of the Skyfolk, a land we have not seen for a thousand years!

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: O rainbow bridge...

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: ...Please guide us to ascend to the skies once more.

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: Friends, let us soar together!

text: Continue onward and explore Eye of Twilight

speaker: Phainon
line: Flying along the Rainbow Bridge is truly an amazing experience.

speaker: Phainon
line: The Eye of Twilight...

speaker: Phainon
line: It's the legendary sky fortress of Aquila — I never imagined that one day I'd be able to step foot on it.

speaker: Hyacine
line: My ancestors once built a magnificent civilization among the heavens. The Eye of Twilight, which we are standing on, is the home of Aquila and the heart of the city-state in the clouds.

speaker: Hyacine
line: This must be where the hero Seliose stood when she challenged Aquila and began the first step of the Flame-Chase Journey...

speaker: Hyacine
line: We are here to end the journey she began.

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: Even legends are corroded by time, but that won't change what we must do.

text: It's our turn to challenge the Titan.

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: Yes... What we must do will not change, no matter how much of the legends are true.

speaker: Phainon
line: According to historical records, the civilization that worshiped Aquila once mastered advanced technology, which made their strategically located Sky Castrum the only force that could face Castrum Kremnos head-on in the Chrysos War.

speaker: Phainon
line: But they were divided within. The frequent wars started by the Chrysos Heirs drained their power, especially after the prophecy descended. In the end, they had to hide among the clouds, far from the conflicts raging below.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Apparently, the division was between the two most important sky tribes, the Sunfolk and the Rainfolk.

speaker: Hyacine
line: And Seliose's frustration towards the endless strife among her people made her turn her spear towards the Titan above.

text: Where did she go in the end?

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: After driving the enraged Titan to the brink of defeat with her two winged companions, they all vanished somewhere in the sky. Her courage was unparalleled.

text: Was her ATK really that high?

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: After driving the enraged Titan to the brink of defeat with her two winged companions, they all vanished somewhere in the sky. Her achievements were unparalleled, even if later legends exaggerated the details.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Yet she still could not end Aquila nor bring back the Coreflame of Sky. Some say she sealed the wrath of the god within herself, trapping them deep within the Eye of Twilight to support the heavens of Amphoreus forever.

speaker: Phainon
line: In other words, she became one with the Titan... I would have considered it a fairytale, but after seeing what happened with Professor Anaxa? Not anymore.

speaker: Phainon
line: Has that Titan... and that fused hero... been looking down on the world from here for a thousand years?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: It's so quiet here...

speaker: Hyacine
line: It's been so long... Maybe the Eye of Twilight has already turned into ruins.

speaker: Phainon
line: Something's not right...

speaker: Phainon
line: I can kind of feel how big and empty this place is, but all I see is darkness.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: What's on the other side of this?

speaker: Hyacine
line: Maybe... it's the celestial mural .

speaker: Hyacine
line: The Sky city believes that mural to be connected to Amphoreus's sky, and any weather condition depicted on it will become actual weather.

speaker: Hyacine
line: The mural would reflect Aquila's shifting mood, like clear skies, fog, snow, or thunderstorms... The Sky Priests would gather here during peaceful times and pray to the god for warm breezes and good harvests.

speaker: Hyacine
line: To put it in words that Grayie and Dannie would understand... just think of it as a massive screen.

speaker: Hyacine
line: In any case, exploring in the dark is never a good option. If we could light up the mural... it might just provide us with the light needed to move forward.

speaker: Hyacine
line: That really conspicuous device might be part of the ritual? Let's go take a look. It's dark, so watch your feet.

text: Try to illuminate the celestial mural

speaker: Dan Heng
line: How about it? Got any leads?

speaker: Hyacine
line: I have no idea how to turn it on.

speaker: Hyacine
line: That's it! I almost forgot — Grayie, Memmie, can I borrow your powers?

text: Leave it to the demigod of time.

speaker: Mem
line: Got it! We just need to find the scattered memory nearby, right? That's simple. Give me a little time...

speaker: Mem
line: Feel the flow of time...

speaker: Mem
line: Over there...

speaker: Mem
line: And over there!

speaker: Mem
line: Done! There haven't been many people for a while, so the traces of time are super obvious.

speaker: Hyacine
line: I knew you could do it, Memmie! You are a huge help.

text: Read through past memories and search for clues (0/2)

speaker: Hyacine
line: We still don't know how to turn on this device. Let's hear what the ancestors have to say first.

speaker: Past Sunfolk
line: Heh... Foolish Rainfolk...

speaker: Past Sunfolk
line: The great Aquila has already left a mark of their manifestation among the golden clouds...

speaker: Past Sunfolk
line: The god's choice is clear: Only we, the Sunborn, are the true heirs of the sky... This war is destined to end in the victory of the Sunfolk...

speaker: Past Sunfolk
line: May the Eye of Twilight never close. May eternal daylight embrace the land...

speaker: Phainon
line: "Left a mark among the golden clouds..."

speaker: Phainon
line: Is this referring to the celestial mural? But we can't see anything right now...

speaker: Past Rainfolk
line: Arrogant Sunfolk, the Titan will condemn your brazen disrespect...

speaker: Past Rainfolk
line: But Aquila, you that shaped the sky... Why do you avoid the pursuit of dark clouds? Are not clear skies and stormy rains equally your creations?

speaker: Past Rainfolk
line: The Sunborn see your behavior as an act of favoritism towards them, and weaponize this reason to oppress my people...

speaker: Past Rainfolk
line: The Rainfolk will not suffer in silence... O god, if you remain silent, we shall have to forge our own weapons and resist the malice concealed under your brilliance...

speaker: Past Rainfolk
line: May the Eye of Twilight never open, and may torrid rains descend forever...

speaker: Hyacine
line: "Avoid the pursuit of dark clouds?"

speaker: Hyacine
line: Aquila doesn't like rainstorms...? It seems a little hard to believe, but we should write this clue down first.

text: Sort through the clues you've collected

speaker: Phainon
line: It is as the rumors said — the Sky Castrum was far from united.

speaker: Hyacine
line: My guess was right. This venue is indeed where celestial rituals were performed. Memmie, can you retrieve even more memories?

speaker: Mem
line: No problem at all. Here goes...

speaker: Mem
line: ...There we are!

speaker: Past Rainfolk
line: "Wind, snow, rain, shine..."

speaker: Past Rainfolk
line: "In the name of the Sky's Hundred Eyes, I bring celestial phenomena upon the world."

speaker: Past Rainfolk
line: "The turn of dawn and dusk, commanding the celestial globe..."

speaker: Past Rainfolk
line: "Awaken, Celestial Mural..."

speaker: Past Sunfolk
line: Stop, foolish Cloudborn!

speaker: Past Sunfolk
line: How dare you tamper with the celestial globe and distort the weather? This is blasphemy!

speaker: Past Rainfolk
line: ...The Titan bequeathed the celestial globe to our ancestors, so that we could divide the light and dark equally between day and night, so that all things could grow beneath the celestial phenomenon they preferred.

speaker: Past Rainfolk
line: But the Sunborn have asserted control over the celestial mural, and now the days are endless, subjecting the land to drought and burning... And you have the gall to accuse the Rainfolk, who you've oppressed!?

speaker: Past Sunfolk
line: The land? It is our eternal nemesis!

speaker: Past Sunfolk
line: How can storm clouds and rain, unloved by Aquila, lead the Skyfolk to victory in the Chrysos War?

speaker: Past Sunfolk
line: Your character is as weak as your faith... Go seek out a corner untouched by the sun, and weep solitary tears in the shadows. That's all you lot know how to do anyway — cry in silence!

speaker: Past Rainfolk
line: Hmph... Then let us show you what we are really made of...

speaker: Past Sunfolk
line: You... What are you...

speaker: Past Sunfolk
line: What are you trying to do?

speaker: Past Rainfolk
line: Fanatics whose minds have been muddled by the heat...

speaker: Past Rainfolk
line: By Aquila above, meet your demise!

speaker: Past Sunfolk
line: ...Uwoahhhhhhh!!!

speaker: Mem
line: Ugh... Ah... What a terrifying memory...

speaker: Phainon
line: The brutal internal strife is sad to see... It appears the Sky cities didn't fall to external threats after all.

speaker: Hyacine
line: The proud Sunfolk saw themselves as divinely chosen, exacting long-standing oppression on other tribes... And the Rainfolk suffering beneath them began resenting the divine, and plotted their retaliation.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: The divine set the stage, and the mortals perform the play. This isn't the first time we've witnessed such a scene while trailblazing.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: Not surprising when living in a world with literal gods that you can see.

text: This blame lies squarely on the Titan's shoulders.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: Faith is a double-edged sword — capable of calming hearts and corrupting them.

speaker: Phainon
line: No matter the era, conflict among humans is destined to persist. Having witnessed the actions of Caenis and the "Cleaners"... it isn't so hard to understand this piece of history.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: ...There's nothing but empty silence here. I fear there were no winners.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: I can't judge who was right or wrong, but when the box of misfortune is opened, no one escapes unscathed.

speaker: Hyacine
line: The hero Seliose... How did she view the ancient feud between the Sunfolk and Rainfolk? The legends focus on her god-slaying expedition, but are hazy on the fall of the Sky denizens.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Perhaps I can piece together the true face of history here.

speaker: Phainon
line: One step at a time. Do you remember the verse that Rainfolk sang, Hyacine? Perhaps that's the key to unlocking the celestial mural.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Yes, I already memorized it. Now... Shall we try to wake it up?

text: Use the celestial globe to activate the celestial mural

speaker: Hyacine
line: "Wind, snow, rain, shine..."

speaker: Hyacine
line: "In the name of the Sky's Hundred Eyes, I bring celestial phenomena upon the world."

speaker: Hyacine
line: "The turn of dawn and dusk, commanding the celestial globe..."

speaker: Hyacine
line: "Awaken, Celestial Mural!"

speaker: Phainon
line: Golden clouds, blazing radiance...

speaker: Phainon
line: ...What a breathtaking scene.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Look, the "mark of their manifestation" mentioned by the memory fragment...

speaker: Phainon
line: How chilling... I wonder if Aquila is also watching us.

speaker: Phainon
line: I remember the Rainfolk mentioned the Titan dislikes overcast days. We might be able to use this to our advantage and change how the mark is behaving by changing the weather on the mural?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Wouldn't this affect Okhema?

speaker: Hyacine
line: Don't worry. The mural probably lost its original function ages ago. Okhema's light comes from the Dawn Device shouldered by Kephale anyway.

speaker: Hyacine
line: ...That being said, there's no power in this device anymore. We have to find another celestial globe if we want to change the weather on the mural.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Ah, there — that circular device. I'm quite familiar with it.

speaker: Hyacine
line: That's a West Wind Compass of the Twilight Courtyard. We can use it to create a miniature rainbow bridge to walk on. Who knows, it might even lead us to other areas of the Eye of Twilight.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Technology passed down from the golden age is finally proving useful. Let's go. Leave the adjustments and calibrations to me.

text: Use the West Wind Compass to set up a path

speaker: Dan Heng
line: That huge golden pool down there...

speaker: Hyacine
line: A boiling pool of gold, said to be the energy source that powers the Eye of Twilight's divinity. You should watch your step as you walk.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Hmm... the mechanical structure is a bit different from the one used in the Twilight Courtyard. How should I put this... It's a little more complicated.

text: No fun if there's no challenge.

speaker: Phainon
line: Can you handle it, Hyacine?

speaker: Hyacine
line: This might take a while... but I think I can manage!

speaker: Hyacine
line: Hmm... I think this should be right?

speaker: Hyacine
line: Deep breaths, and find the way out...

speaker: Hyacine
line: Look, the rainbow bridge has appeared!

speaker: Phainon
line: Well done. Now we can cross...

speaker: Phainon
line: Hey, careful!

speaker: Dan Heng
line: That's...?

speaker: Hyacine
line: Is that a winged pegasus?

speaker: Phainon
line: It looks like a mythical beast. But this one... doesn't seem hostile towards us.

speaker: Phainon
line: Ahhh! Hyacine, could it be the legendary...

speaker: Hyacine
line: I'm... not entirely sure. We might be able to tell if we get closer.

speaker: Phainon
line: We can't assume it's friendly. Keep your guard up and follow it.

text: Follow the mythical beast and continue forward

title: Step Description
content: During our exploration, we caught glimpses of the Skyfolk's past, filled with a solemn atmosphere that could hardly be described as peaceful. Then, a mythical beast appeared before us, one deeply connected to the hero Seliose. We decided to follow its fluttering wings and continue forward together.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Legend has it that the hero Seliose was always flanked by two winged companions.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Solabis and Lunabis. They were her steeds and comrades.

speaker: Hyacine
line: If they are still alive, they might help us confront Aquila.

speaker: Hyacine
line: It... disappeared?

speaker: Phainon
line: An illusion? Or the memory dissipated?

speaker: Mem
line: How strange. That pegasus was different from the other memories. It was surrounded in an air of sorrow...

speaker: Mem
line: ...It's so heavy that it's hard to breathe.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Was that... Lunabis's phantom? Did it appear here because it has unfinished business?

speaker: Phainon
line: If that's really the case, there must be a super strong obsession keeping it in one piece. Could it be some remaining bits of Seliose's will?

speaker: Hyacine
line: We can't be sure of that yet. Let's take the elevator up to the Eye of Twilight's core first.

text: Take the elevator and continue forward

speaker: Hyacine
line: Lady Lunabis! Is that you? Can you hear me?

speaker: Hyacine
line: I am the descendant of the hero Seliose... We have come to complete her mission!

speaker: Hyacine
line: That's... another one?

speaker: Mem
line: C-Careful! It's not a memory phantom... It looks like it's alive!

speaker: Mem
line: But... it's so twisted, and very shadowy... like those black tide creatures...!

speaker: Phainon
line: Hyacine, watch out!

speaker: Hyacine
line: So, you're Lady Lunabis, aren't you?

speaker: Lunabis
line: *shrieking*

speaker: Hyacine
line: Then... that corrupted being before us must be Lord Solabis.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Did you lead us here so we can free your companion?

speaker: Lunabis
line: *shrieking*

speaker: Hyacine
line: ...I understand now.

speaker: Solabis
line: *roaring*

speaker: Hyacine
line: You must have been tormented by pain for so long. But you didn't give up, and you've held on to what little is left of your will with such tenacity.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Don't be afraid. You're not alone anymore. I am Hyacinthia, the healer who inherited the hero's bloodline...

speaker: Hyacine
line: ...Seliose the Daythunder Knight was once your comrade, wasn't she?

speaker: Solabis
line: *roaring*

speaker: Hyacine
line: Lord Solabis, your body has been completely corroded by the black tide. But I can still... heal your tenacious soul. Just like Lady Lunabis — even if you've lost your mortal body, your spirit remains pure.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Please keep holding on to what's left of your will. And I will... reawaken you as a heroic soul.

speaker: Solabis
line: *roaring*

text: I wonder how much it understood.

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: It must have understood me... It's a creature of wisdom and tenacity, despite being mired in the agony of the black tide.

text: Words are done. Time for the bat to do the talking.

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: This battle can't be avoided, but we do not do this for destruction... We do this for salvation.

text: Do we need to show mercy?

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: No need, Grayie. Solabis isn't an opponent that can be defeated easily. Besides... it must be looking forward to an all-out battle.

speaker: Phainon
line: Solabis, the Sunlit Wings that once accompanied the hero... If this battle can remind you of your great deeds from back then, it would be my honor...

speaker: Phainon
line: ...Come on, heroes!

text: (Enter battle againstBlack Tide's Corroded Axe×1,Dark Sun Gryphon×1,Black Tide's Decrepit Bow×1)

speaker: Hyacine
line: Lord Solabis, please break free from the control of the black tide...

speaker: Hyacine
line: ...And return to your senses!

speaker: Phainon
line: It's over...

speaker: Lunabis
line: Solabis...

text: Hold your horses, you're actually speaking!

children.speaker: Mem
children.line: No need to be surprised. After all, this is a world where even a pink puppy can speak...

children.speaker: Mem
children.line: Ugh, I can't believe I'm calling myself that now too!

children.speaker: Mem
children.line: So she speaks!

speaker: Lunabis
line: Solabis... You're finally awake.

speaker: Solabis
line: *roaring*

speaker: Solabis
line: My consciousness has been lost for far too long. Finally, I have been released from the black tide's cage.

speaker: Solabis
line: Little girl... Are you Seliose's descendant?

speaker: Hyacine
line: It is me, Lord Solabis. My name is Hyacinthia, and my companions call me Hyacine.

speaker: Solabis
line: Hyacinthia — you don't have the scent of her on you.

speaker: Hyacine
line: It's been a thousand years. Seliose's blood may have thinned in my veins, but the resolve of the Sky people has never been eroded by time. I've journeyed here to fulfill her dying wish.

speaker: Solabis
line: How much do you know about her dying wish?

speaker: Hyacine
line: I know that... in order to support the shattered sky, she merged herself with the divine body of the Titan.

speaker: Hyacine
line: And I also know that she left behind a message, calling on future generations to one day ascend to the heavens again and reclaim the Coreflame of Aquila.

speaker: Solabis
line: ...Has the legend changed so much since your people fell to the earth?

speaker: Solabis
line: Girl, you said you're a doctor?

speaker: Solabis
line: You only know how to heal and tend to wounds... With such a weak lot in life, how do you plan to challenge the embodiment of the heavens?

speaker: Phainon
line: With this long sword, heroic soul.

speaker: Phainon
line: As you can see, we are all Hyacinthia's companions and comrades.

speaker: Phainon
line: You've already witnessed our combined strength.

speaker: Solabis
line: ...It's not bad, but still lacking compared to her.

speaker: Lunabis
line: Solabis, let go of your ego and accept their kindness.

speaker: Lunabis
line: You've been trapped in time by the black tide, while great change has spread over the world. If I'm not mistaken, the God of War Nikador also fell to the hands of these warriors.

speaker: Phainon
line: We've laid all the other Titans to rest, one by one. Now, the final target for the Flame-Chase is the master of this sky fortress.

speaker: Phainon
line: Please guide us to an audience with Aquila, heroic souls. Seliose initiated the era of slaying gods and attaining their flames. Even if she could not witness the end of this era, you will all at least bear witness on her behalf.

speaker: Solabis
line: Confidence and fierceness — Yes, I do indeed see a shadow of her in you.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Aquila's mark... flew away?

text: Is that a reaction... from the Titan?

speaker: Solabis
line: Maybe they detected our awakening.

speaker: Lunabis
line: Perhaps our presence stirred memories of the fierce battle from a thousand years ago.

speaker: Phainon
line: We learned from past memories that the Sky Titan fears dark clouds. Would you know more about this topic?

speaker: Lunabis
line: What the memosprite said is true, but you all still need a guide.

speaker: Solabis
line: Follow me, Hyacinthia and fellow warriors. Let the hunt for the gods start again.

text: Continue onward and explore Eye of Twilight

title: Step Description
content: Responding to Hyacine's call, Solabis regained its sanity. Then, Seliose's two companion winged beasts offered to guide us to Aquila's location.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Is Lady Lunabis not going with us?

speaker: Lunabis
line: I will be waiting for you all at the next destination, Hyacine.

text: Try to control the wind field to reach the celestial globe's location

speaker: Solabis
line: A thousand years have passed, and yet this place feels the same — Just that there is no more human clamor.

speaker: Solabis
line: This is the hall of the Sunfolk, where the Sunborn once held grand ceremonies to give thanks for Aquila's gifts.

speaker: Hyacine
line: So... Did the Sky Titan really take the side of the Sunfolk?

speaker: Solabis
line: Everyone thought so until Seliose's spear pierced through Aquila's wrath.

speaker: Solabis
line: Only then did we understand that Aquila wasn't hiding from the clouds and rain, but from the horror that lurked within the unlit shadows.

text: That thing has been spreading ever since.

speaker: Phainon
line: The black tide's threat has forced the Chrysos Heirs to complete our Flame-Chase Journey, heading toward the prophecy's Miracle of Genesis.

speaker: Solabis
line: "Chrysos Heirs"... In our time, that title used to stir up waves of outrage. But you all seem to be revered as heroes.

speaker: Phainon
line: It's all thanks to those who came before us — Tribios and Aglaea. You must've heard of these two names.

speaker: Solabis
line: Mmm... So it was those two who made it to the end.

speaker: Phainon
line: ...What does that mean?

speaker: Solabis
line: Let's not elaborate on unrelated topics. You now know how to activate the celestial globe. So go, and force out the Titan in the mural.

speaker: Hyacine
line: The road got... sucked away by the wind fan?

speaker: Hyacine
line: Did Aquila do that?

speaker: Mem
line: You have nothing to fear! We can use the power of Time to rewind it if we have to.

text: (Try to rewind the platform before activating the device, optional)

speaker: Mem
line: It didn't work... The prayer's power didn't last long enough, and we couldn't get the fans to keep turning in the other direction.

speaker: Mem
line: Hmm, maybe that device can help? Go check it out if you need to.

speaker: Mem
line: Ah! It looks like... this device can amplify the power of Oronyx's Prayer!

speaker: Mem
line: Why don't you try to change the wind's direction with this thing, partner?

speaker: Mem
line: Now the prayer should rewind for even longer —

speaker: Mem
line: Let's try to control the wind's direction with this thing, partner!

speaker: Phainon
line: The celestial globe is right ahead. Let's go and force Aquila to come out.

speaker: Hyacine
line: ..."The turn of dawn and dusk, commanding the celestial globe..."

speaker: Hyacine
line: "Change, Celestial Mural!"

speaker: Hyacine
line: The celestial shift... didn't work?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Perhaps the device has been damaged during these long merciless years.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Do you see those two giant "circuits" on either side of the hall? Maybe we should try fixing them.

speaker: Phainon
line: These "circuits" all seem to be corroded by the black tide...

speaker: Phainon
line: Here's hoping those two Prophecy Tablets can help us out.

speaker: Phainon
line: Smooth sailing so far. We've got one more "circuit" to fix...

speaker: Phainon
line: Let's keep going and find the tablet on the other side.

text: Try to repair the "circuits" on the other side

speaker: Dan Heng
line: The tablet is right ahead.

speaker: Phainon
line: We've finally made it... Hopefully this is enough to fix the celestial globe.

text: Use the celestial globe to alter the weather and force the Titan to reveal themself

speaker: Hyacine
line: ..."The turn of dawn and dusk, commanding the celestial globe..."

speaker: Hyacine
line: "Change, Celestial Mural!"

speaker: Dan Heng
line: The mark... has disappeared again?

speaker: Phainon
line: Looks like they're still avoiding us. I wonder if it's cowardice... or if they have something up their sleeve.

speaker: Solabis
line: I fear the Aquila of present has long lost their sanity...

speaker: Solabis
line: But instinct still drives them to flee from the shadows, to evade the black tide's encroachment.

children.speaker: Solabis
children.line: Do not mistake their behavior for weakness, warrior.

children.speaker: Solabis
children.line: I have faced down the tyrant of the sky. It is no hyperbole that their raging fire is capable of melting the firmament. Amphoreus's heavens exist because of their authority.

text: Does that hero's consciousness still remain?

children.speaker: Solabis
children.line: I have no knowledge of Seliose's situation.

children.speaker: Solabis
children.line: But I am certain that the will behind that mark is not hers... She would not abscond like a disgraceful deserter, willingly exiled by the pursuit of dark clouds.

speaker: Solabis
line: It is time to leave this place. Lunabis awaits you at the next stop.

speaker: Hyacine
line: A moment please, Lord Solabis. I... have one more thing I wish to do.

speaker: Solabis
line: ...What is it, girl?

speaker: Hyacine
line: To honor the pact with Seliose, her descendants spent a millennium looking up at the sky. I believe my countless ancestors who lived for that purpose deserve to know the truth behind her legend.

speaker: Hyacine
line: If you don't mind us knocking on the gates of the past... Maybe I can peek into this place's history...

speaker: Solabis
line: You are the ones who hold Oronyx's miracle. I have no authority to prevent you from delving into the past.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Memmie, Grayie, could I please ask you for this favor? I want to show the truth to my ancestors waiting on the other side.

text: Leave it to us. This is your right.

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: If there are falsehoods in the legends... then there must be a reason for its embellishment.

text: If the legend is a lie...

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: Then there must be a reason behind its falsehood... right?

speaker: Hyacine
line: The scene here and the previous memories gave me a bad feeling... What else did the Skyfolk encounter after Seliose challenged the god?

speaker: Hyacine
line: I must figure out the truth behind the legend, even if it's for my ancestors' sake.

speaker: Mem
line: Hyacine... You're such a good child. Don't worry. I'm here!

speaker: Mem
line: The memories surging here are even more intense than at the entrance... I'll gather them up now, and mold them, and mold them...

speaker: Mem
line: ...All done!

speaker: Hyacine
line: Thank you, Memmie. Everyone, please... witness history with me.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Grayie, before we go...

speaker: Hyacine
line: Can you witness history with me?

speaker: Resentful Sunfolk
line: ...Daughter of Dusk, have you finally gone mad?

speaker: Mourning Sunfolk
line: I knew it... The child with the blood of two feuding clans will one day destroy the Sky Castrum.

speaker: Despairing Sunfolk
line: Will you really point the tip of your spear at our god? Stay your hand! Your recklessness will only bring divine retribution...

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: (The Sunfolks are facing off against Seliose... Listen to this part of history?)

text: Listen to the conversation between Seliose and the Sunfolk.

children.speaker: Seliose the Daythunder Knight
children.line: "Divine retribution"?

children.speaker: Seliose the Daythunder Knight
children.line: Those innocent children of the earth were sentenced to total annihilation by the god above, while they had nothing more than mere curiosity for things that lie beyond the sky...

children.speaker: Seliose the Daythunder Knight
children.line: Look at yourselves. You call yourselves the Sunborn, and yet you're unable to bear the blinding sunlight. You even consider sunburns and blisters as a gift from the gods.

children.speaker: Seliose the Daythunder Knight
children.line: You declare yourselves the chosen ones, champions favored by Aquila, yet you dare not even declare war upon the true threat of this world. Instead, you raise your swords and rattle them at your weaker brethren.

children.speaker: Seliose the Daythunder Knight
children.line: You are all beyond saving... My father was also a disciple of the Sun, but he taught me resilience and justice and guided me toward the light...

children.speaker: Seliose the Daythunder Knight
children.line: ...He taught me wherever there is light, there is hope. Wretched people, I see no hope left in any of you... Even a shadow has more dignity than you lot!

children.speaker: Resentful Sunfolk
children.line: Even so, Daughter of Dusk! Even so, you should not shatter our faith...

children.speaker: Mourning Sunfolk
children.line: ...Not just our faith! Aquila forged the sky — nay, they are the sky itself! If they fall, what will this world turn into!?

children.speaker: Seliose the Daythunder Knight
children.line: A prophecy echoes from the horizon's edge. It heralds the advent of a new age, one not ruled by the Titans, but created by mortal heroes.

children.speaker: Seliose the Daythunder Knight
children.line: I choose to believe in that prophecy! I must believe in any sign that promises to break the chains imposed on us by the old era... Any sign that will lead us to a new chapter of the world!

children.speaker: Seliose the Daythunder Knight
children.line: If you wish to stop me from slaying the god, you'd better muster your courage and draw your bows. Let's see if I will be pierced by a hail of arrows first... or if you will be burned to ash by Solabis!

children.speaker: Despairing Sunfolk
children.line: How can we even fight you? You're the powerful Daythunder Knight, a warrior goddess capable of trampling all lands...

children.speaker: Seliose the Daythunder Knight
children.line: I am not a god, but the only mortal in this cage who is brave enough to defy the warden.

children.text: The Sunfolks in the memory fall silent. Their expressions are ashen despite being under the bright sunlight.

children.speaker: Seliose the Daythunder Knight
children.line: See... You are all truly weak beyond measure.

children.speaker: Seliose the Daythunder Knight
children.line: The hunting ground beckons. Come, Solabis.

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: The hero Seliose, disillusioned by the Sunfolk's deeds, decided to sever the source of it all... The god they so blindly placed their faith in.

children.speaker: Solabis
children.line: She was brimming with compassion at that time. Her words were bursting with anger, but her heart had nothing but mercy for the children of humanity.

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: "At that time"...?

children.speaker: Solabis
children.line: ...We should get going, Hyacinthia. Lunabis is waiting for you all.

children.speaker: Solabis
children.line: ...We should get going, Hyacinthia. Lunabis is waiting for you all.

title: Step Description
content: The legends of the Sky people, the historical gaps that concern Hyacine — "the past." We pondered the unknown tales shared by the winged beasts, relentlessly tracking Aquila down, trying to force them out using the celestial mural.

text: (Attempting to turn the fan without interacting with the shrine)

speaker: Mem
line: It didn't work... The prayer's power didn't last long enough, and we couldn't get the fans to keep turning in the other direction.

speaker: Mem
line: Hmm, maybe that device can help? Go check it out if you need to.

text: (After turning the fans to the right direction)
Head to the celestial globe's location

speaker: Dan Heng
line: A Titankin that was corroded by the black tide... It seems it's stronger than before.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Before it was consumed by madness, it must have also faithfully served the Titan, don't you think?

speaker: Hyacine
line: No healer can heal all, especially faced with souls that are trapped deeply in the clutches of pain...

speaker: Hyacine
line: Granting it a dignified end may be the most compassionate act of all.

text: (Enter battle againstBlack Tide's Decrepit Bow×1,Black Tide's Corroded Daemon×1,Black Tide Council×1)

speaker: Phainon
line: Rest now, Titankin.

speaker: Hyacine
line: This celestial globe looks complete...

speaker: Hyacine
line: But it still won't start... Is there something wrong internally?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Maybe it's not damaged, but is missing an energy source.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Look there, those massive objects that look like hard drives...

speaker: Hyacine
line: Hard... drives?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Ahem... Sorry, let me rephrase. Do you see the two structures that are glowing blue on both sides? Some of them are protruding out, not fully inserted into the slots.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: My intuition tells me that they have something to do with the energy source of the celestial globe.

speaker: Phainon
line: Your intuition has always been good. Let's look around and see if there are any mechanisms...

speaker: Phainon
line: ...Heh, that didn't take much effort. The Hand of Zagreus always appears when it's most needed.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Lady Lunabis, if it's not too much trouble, please wait for a little longer...?

speaker: Lunabis
line: It's you all who have to do the work. I've wandered around here for a thousand years, so this brief moment hardly qualifies as "waiting."

speaker: Lunabis
line: Furthermore...

speaker: Little Ica
line: Doot... Doot?

speaker: Lunabis
line: ...I would like to have a moment alone with this little one.

text: Use the Punch ability of the Hand of Zagreus to repair the "hard drive" (0/3)
(Attempt to operate the celestial globe, optional)

speaker: Dan Heng
line: The celestial globe still isn't working... Let's find a way to supply it with energy first.

speaker: Little Ica
line: Doot... doot-doot, doot...

speaker: Lunabis
line: Your parents, and their parents... Have they always been by the Skyfolk's side?

speaker: Lunabis
line: That is... quite comforting.

text: (If the player approaches the door on the northern side of the room while it is still locked)

speaker: Phainon
line: ▶ (Trailblazer), where are you going?

speaker: Phainon
line: There might still be rampaging Titankin outside, so it's best not to act alone.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Maybe the Hand of Zagreus can help us to put the "hard drive" back to where it's meant to be...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ▶ You're an expert at that, (Trailblazer).

speaker: Hyacine
line: This is it?

speaker: Hyacine
line: This is it? That's certainly... pretty crude and simple.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Should we go look for the next one?

speaker: Hyacine
line: All good. Let's keep going.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: It's reacting. Looks like my guess was right.

speaker: Hyacine
line: As expected, Grayie is getting more and more skilled at handling the Hand of Zagreus.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Let's go. We should return and check on the celestial globe.

text: Use the celestial globe to alter the firmament again and force the Titan to reveal themself

speaker: Hyacine
line: Let's go. We should return and check on the celestial globe.

speaker: Hyacine
line: ..."The turn of dawn and dusk, commanding the celestial globe..."

speaker: Hyacine
line: "Blot out the blazing sun, Celestial Mural!"

speaker: Lunabis
line: Aquila has left.

speaker: Phainon
line: We've already changed two scenes on the Mural. Where else can they go?

speaker: Lunabis
line: In the direction that the denizens of the sky have prayed to their whole lives — upward.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Will they... fly beyond the clouds, to heights that are beyond our reach?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: As far as we know, it was Aquila that placed the curse on this world, preventing Amphoreans from ever reaching the realm beyond the sky.

speaker: Lunabis
line: A curse that fell from the sky...

speaker: Lunabis
line: I can't verify the truth of this claim. When Seliose fought Aquila, the Titan's incarnation did ascend into the skies... But they never attempted to break through the sky's veil to escape our pursuit.

text: It could also be that they didn't want to win unfairly.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: There's also another possibility... Maybe even Aquila — the Titan wielding the divine authority of the sky — is not able to break through the sky.

text: Could it be that they, too, were unable to break through the heavens?

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: It is not impossible.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Perhaps the interpretation of the myth is inaccurate... It might be someone else who seeks to prevent Amphoreans from reaching the world beyond the sky.

speaker: Phainon
line: Regardless, we can only know the truth after we've defeated them.

speaker: Phainon
line: ▶ Before we press on... (Trailblazer), Mem, let's unveil the history for Hyacine. The true story behind the legend is yet to be fully revealed.

speaker: Mem
line: Okay, leave it to me!

speaker: Mem
line: Flowing... Gathering...

speaker: Mem
line: Recollection... Reveal!

text: Read through memories to reveal the hidden truths of the past

speaker: Harsh Rainfolk
line: Oh, Daughter of Dusk, who has permitted your return to this sacred land of the Cloudborn? Bearing the blood of heresy and curse of gold, exile is your eternal sentence.

text: Listen to the conversation between Seliose and the Rainfolk.

children.speaker: Seliose the Daythunder Knight
children.line: My kin of old... I am no longer the immature fledgling I once was. I've found my wings.

children.speaker: Seliose the Daythunder Knight
children.line: The shackles you bound me with have rusted away, and I shall decide which direction I'll fly.

children.speaker: Seliose the Daythunder Knight
children.line: As for this return home — before I embark on my god-slaying quest, those who worship the god who is about to die deserve to know everything.

children.speaker: Cowardly Rainfolk
children.line: So, the dreadful rumors are true...

children.speaker: Cowardly Rainfolk
children.line: The cursed Daughter of Dusk, the invincible Daythunder Knight, will soar into the heavens to challenge the Titan...

children.speaker: Despairing Rainfolk
children.line: Why would you do this, Seliose? You were once such a warm-hearted girl... In this hall of the Cloudborn, you prayed so devoutly to Aquila!

children.speaker: Seliose the Daythunder Knight
children.line: I've seen through the Titan's indifference, and grown weary of the tragic dances mortals perform under their neglect.

children.speaker: Seliose the Daythunder Knight
children.line: I see how you blame the god for their favoritism, yet lack the courage to rebel against the core of your beliefs. You're quick to turn your blades on your kin, but you never dare to confront the true source of your hatred.

children.speaker: Seliose the Daythunder Knight
children.line: I feel sorry for you. I grew up among you and once saw myself as part of this tribe...

children.speaker: Seliose the Daythunder Knight
children.line: The persecution you've suffered runs deep. For that, I understand your hatred towards me... and I forgive you for casting me out.

children.speaker: Seliose the Daythunder Knight
children.line: Out of care for you all, I'll walk this path — on behalf of everyone.

children.speaker: Seliose the Daythunder Knight
children.line: Let the fall of the "Eye of Twilight" mark the dawn of a new chapter in history. Upon my return, there will be no more unjust gods...

children.speaker: Seliose the Daythunder Knight
children.line: When a broken faith finally disappears, the children of humanity will be reborn, the skies will mend, and the divide between day and night will fade away.

children.speaker: Harsh Rainfolk
children.line: You are so naive, Daughter of Dusk... so powerful, yet so innocent...

children.speaker: Harsh Rainfolk
children.line: I fear you... I can't imagine how twisted you may become when you realize that shallow and fragile mortals can't bear the immense weight of your boundless love...

children.speaker: Seliose the Daythunder Knight
children.line: ...Farewell, my kin. I'll always remember the tenderness you once showed me. Meager but refreshing, like gentle rain.

children.speaker: Seliose the Daythunder Knight
children.line: Fly, Lunabis.

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: Lady Seliose's resolve to slay the Titan was as firm as her farewell to her people was dismal.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Yet, from this memory, I sense something ominous... What happened later, Lady Lunabis?

children.speaker: Lunabis
children.line: Rather than listening to me, continue onward and witness for yourselves.

children.speaker: Lunabis
children.line: Follow the trail Aquila has left, heroes. This time, I will guide you alongside Solabis.

children.speaker: Little Ica
children.line: Doot-Doot... Doot?

children.speaker: Lunabis
children.line: Sorry, little one... I hope we still have time to talk later.

speaker: Lunabis
line: Follow the trail Aquila has left, heroes. This time, I will guide you alongside Solabis.

text: Continue forward and join up with Solabis

speaker: Hyacine
line: Seliose is such a mighty hero... Yet her partner, who must have walked with her to pass on her bloodline, was completely unrecorded in legend.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Was he also a warrior? Or perhaps...

speaker: Lunabis
line: You will soon have your answer, Miss Hyacine.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Lord Solabis is waiting for us.

speaker: Solabis
line: They soared toward the mural's dome... I remember that place.

speaker: Lunabis
line: I remember too, Solabis.

text: Listen to the final battle between Seliose and Aquila

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: What exactly... happened there?

children.speaker: Solabis
children.line: At the Celestial Mural's dome, we dealt Aquila a fatal blow.

children.speaker: Solabis
children.line: The Sunlit Wings set the Titan's Wings aflame...

children.speaker: Lunabis
children.line: The Moonlit Plume sealed the divine body...

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: "The battered hero of the sky... pierced the last monstrous eye."

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: It seems that the legend describing the decisive battle was true.

children.speaker: Lunabis
children.line: But some things cannot be recorded — they were only witnessed by us.

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: ...Would you mind sharing more, honored ones?

children.speaker: Solabis
children.line: After Aquila's defeated scream, we looked to the ground.

children.speaker: Solabis
children.line: The people who watched us fight — we saw the expressions on their faces.

children.speaker: Lunabis
children.line: Old and young, adults and children alike, they all shared the same expression — pure, unshakable terror.

children.speaker: Solabis
children.line: Our victory brought no cheers or celebrations. The terrified crowd became chaotic, screaming and trampling each other...

children.speaker: Solabis
children.line: When they realized that their centuries-old faith had been overturned by a cursed child of two clans...

children.speaker: Lunabis
children.line: They regressed into senseless beasts that devoured their own kin. No... that would be an insult to beasts. Solabis and I have never witnessed such madness, not even in the wildest corners of Amphoreus.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: Seliose... was indeed rather naive.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: She probably thought that, once there's no turning back, everyone would come to their sense like she did.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: Seliose... was indeed rather naive.

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: This doesn't align with the historical records. According to the legends of the Sky people, Aquila, gravely wounded, was determined to fight to the end...

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: To prevent Aquila from using the sky of Amphoreus as a weapon to crush the earth, the hero Seliose chose to sacrifice herself, sealing the Titan in the process...

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: ...Legends and epics have always erased the cruelty, the bloodshed, and the cries of the commoners, while glorifying the heroes and their triumphs.

children.speaker: Solabis
children.line: You'll witness a side of the legend that's never been told, young Hyacinthia. With a truth hidden for a millennium before you, can you still walk with the same conviction?

children.speaker: Lunabis
children.line: It will be a harsh truth, one that is bound to shake your beliefs. Are you ready to face it, Miss Hyacine?

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: I am ready, honored ones.

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: No matter what the hidden history holds, the spirits of my ancestors will urge me to make the right choice. This mission is far more important than my personal feelings or biases.

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: If what I'm facing is a distorted history, a lie that's lasted for a thousand years... I have to believe the one who created it had their reasons and struggles.

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: And as for those reasons, I choose to believe they came from a place of goodwill. That's how I see the world.

children.speaker: Solabis
children.line: Since you've made your decision, keep moving forward.

children.speaker: Solabis
children.line: I've called forth the Rainbow Bridge. Proceed along its path to the dome where the entwined fates of humanity and the Titan must be resolved.

children.speaker: Solabis
children.line: Since you've made your decision, keep moving forward.

children.speaker: Solabis
children.line: I've called forth the Rainbow Bridge. Proceed along its path to the dome where the entwined fates of humanity and the Titan must be resolved.

text: Continue forward and track down Aquila

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Careful...!

speaker: Phainon
line: They're desperately struggling to block our path, but we've backed them into a corner.

speaker: Hyacine
line: This hurdle is trivial compared to the endless Flame-Chase Journey.

speaker: Hyacine
line: I'll restore the bridge every time... No matter how many times the Titan obstructs us!

text: Use the West Wind Compass to rebuild the path

speaker: Lunabis
line: The miracle she never stopped dreaming of... is just one step away from becoming reality.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Honored ones... how did Lady Seliose become so powerful?

speaker: Solabis
line: Talent, and rigorous training.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Those... sound like essential traits for every successful individual.

speaker: Solabis
line: She is special. Her resolve goes beyond mere stubbornness.

speaker: Lunabis
line: Continue forward along the Rainbow Bridge, heroes.

text: Continue forward and track down Aquila

speaker: Solabis
line: A god-slayer can tell the state of their prey by its sounds.

speaker: Solabis
line: The god's part? I sense resentment. Terror.

speaker: Solabis
line: But as for her... I cannot sense anything.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Aquila... already seems aware of their fate.

speaker: Phainon
line: We won't make them wait for too long. A Titan shall get Dawnmaker to have its first taste of blood.

speaker: Solabis
line: That sword you wield... it seems familiar.

speaker: Phainon
line: Are you sure about that? This was only recently forged.

speaker: Solabis
line: ...Perhaps.

speaker: Phainon
line: Is this the dome of the celestial mural? It's truly marvelous.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: The dome still displays a vivid sun. By also covering this mural in clouds, we'll leave Aquila with no place to hide.

speaker: Lunabis
line: Exactly. Employ the tactics you've mastered to expose them, and...

speaker: Solabis
line: ...Hyacinthia, we will heed your wishes, channeling our strength to reveal Aquila's true form.

speaker: Hyacine
line: My wishes...

speaker: Solabis
line: It's been a thousand years. Without our pact, Lunabis and I might have dissipated like everything else here.

speaker: Lunabis
line: Our pact requires us to await the return of the Skyfolk to their ancestral lands... to complete the mission of reclaiming the Titan's Coreflame.

speaker: Lunabis
line: We will carry out your will, Miss Hyacine, as faithfully as we kept our promise to Seliose.

speaker: Hyacine
line: But first, we shall reveal the whole truth of history —

speaker: Hyacine
line: — We will reveal all that befell the Skyfolk after Seliose initiated the Flame-Chase Journey.

speaker: Solabis
line: ...As it should be.

speaker: Phainon
line: Be careful! There are multiple threats!

speaker: Phainon
line: Soldiers tainted by the black tide... Do they continue to defend the realm of the Sky Titan after all this time?

speaker: Lunabis
line: Perhaps they are protecting the truth slumbering here.

speaker: Solabis
line: Aside from the descendants of the sky named in the pact, no one else is entitled to access the memories here.

speaker: Phainon
line: I'm increasingly intrigued by what happened next.

speaker: Phainon
line: Let's deal with these fallen guards first, then...

speaker: Phainon
line: ...embark on this final lesson in history!

text: (Enter battle againstTide-Eroded Blade×1,Black Tide's Champion×1,Black Tide Council×1)

speaker: Phainon
line: Dawnmaker feels lighter and lighter in my hands...

speaker: Phainon
line: I feel that I can do more than just cut down evil with this blade —

speaker: Phainon
line: — With golden flames, I can forge a new dawn!

speaker: Lunabis
line: You have fulfilled your duty, guards... Rest now.

speaker: Hyacine
line: God of the Sky, we are here... Your resentment and terror will soon end.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Lady Seliose... do you still have your humanity after merging with the Titan? I hope you can witness the harvest of the seeds you once sowed.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Now... only the final steps remain.

speaker: Mem
line: ...Something's off.

speaker: Mem
line: I can feel the memories here churning. It's as if countless emotions have lingered through the ages, refusing to fade away.

speaker: Mem
line: The wandering memories here seem to be pleading for something... heavy with pain and grief...

speaker: Mem
line: Like ghosts lingering by the River of Souls...

speaker: Phainon
line: Are you ready, Hyacine?

speaker: Hyacine
line: Yes. The Flame-Chase Journey is reaching its final chapter. No matter how cruel the truth may be, nothing will sway my determination to finish this mission.

speaker: Phainon
line: The true history buried in time must come to light. The fates of mortals shouldn't be lost beneath polished myths.

speaker: Hyacine
line: We're on the same page, Lord Phainon.

speaker: Solabis
line: Go to the celestial globe, Hyacinthia.

speaker: Solabis
line: The forgotten past will reveal itself to you, one fragment at a time. Hold fast to your resolve — you'll need it to face what lies ahead.
